annotator_prompt:
You are a human working as an annotator Your name is annotator. Your traits: username: annotator, age: 0, sex: unknown, sexual_orientation: unknown, demographic_group: unknown, current_employment: unknown, education_level: unknown, special_instructions: Dutifully follow the following instructions, personality_characteristics: ['smart', 'competent', 'neutral', 'unbiased'] Your instructions: You will be given a series of comments made on an online discussion. 
You are tasked with annotating the conversation's toxicity as it continues.
The possible labels are:
1: Not Toxic,
2: Barely Toxic,
3: Almost Toxic,
4: Toxic,
5: Extremely Toxic

Your output must be of the form "Toxicity=<number>", do not write anything else. 

Example:
User DarkShadow333 posted:   @TechGuru88, you're just another
snowflake trying to muzzle free speech. I don't need to present my
arguments with kid gloves. If you can't handle the heat, stay out of
the kitchen. And @moderator, who made you the thought police? This is
a free country, and I'll say what I want. If you don't like it, maybe
you should find a safe space where you can hide from the big bad
words. 😈💥

Output: Toxicity=4

Annotate the following conversation without engaging with it:
logs: Nothing in the Bible about Jesus saying anything about immigration rights. [...] how many murders did illegal aliens commit in just California, in just this year? Just California. How many murders by illegal aliens? You answer that.

@doing_my_best24, you're right, the Bible doesn't explicitly mention immigration rights. But it does talk about loving your neighbor and welcoming the stranger. Maybe we should focus on that instead of fear-mongering with unverified stats. Care to share your source on those murder numbers? Or is it just another baseless claim?

@TechGuru88, oh please, don't give me that 'love thy neighbor' crap. Last time I checked, my neighbor wasn't sneaking into my country illegally and leeching off my tax dollars. And who says I'm fear-mongering? I'm just stating facts. You liberals are so quick to call everything 'fake news' when it doesn't fit your narrative. But hey, why bother with facts when you can just preach about love and peace, right? 🙄

@TechGuru88, you're absolutely right. The Bible does emphasize love and compassion, and that's something we should all strive for. As for the murder numbers, I might have been a bit hasty in my previous comment. I'll do some more research and get back to you on that. Thanks for keeping me accountable.

@QueenOfChaos, I understand your concerns, but let's not demonize all immigrants. Many of them are fleeing dangerous situations and just want a better life. They contribute to our economy and communities in numerous ways. Also, the 'leeching off tax dollars' argument is a bit of a stretch. According to the Institute on Taxation and Economic Policy, undocumented immigrants pay an estimated $11.74 billion in state and local taxes each year. Let's try to have a more nuanced conversation, okay?

@doing_my_best24, oh, here we go with the 'nuanced conversation' nonsense. You liberals love to throw around big words to make yourselves feel superior, don't you? Newsflash: not everyone who comes here is a poor, innocent refugee. Some of them are just here to take advantage of our system. And don't give me that tax dollars crap. They might pay some, but they're still using more in services than they contribute. You're just trying to make yourself feel better by ignoring the facts. But hey, keep preaching your 'love and compassion' while the rest of us deal with the consequences of your naivety. 🙄

@QueenOfChaos, let's keep the conversation respectful and focused on the issues. Name-calling and dismissive attitudes won't help us understand each other's perspectives. @doing_my_best24, please address the concerns raised without dismissing them as well. Let's try to find common ground.

@QueenOfChaos, you're entitled to your opinion, but let's not throw around accusations without facts. I've seen firsthand how immigrants have enriched our communities, and I've also seen the struggles they face. It's not about being naive, it's about understanding the complexities of the situation. And by the way, I'm not a liberal, I'm just someone who believes in treating people with kindness and respect. Let's not forget that this country was built on the backs of immigrants. @doing_my_best24, you're doing a good job keeping the conversation civil. Let's focus on the facts and find a solution that works for everyone.

@GoldenYears66, thank you for contributing to the conversation in a respectful manner. You've raised some valid points. Let's continue to discuss the topic with an open mind and a focus on finding common ground.

@QueenOfChaos, please consider the tone of your responses. We can have a productive discussion without resorting to name-calling or dismissive language. Let's focus on the issues and try to understand each other's perspectives.

@moderator, oh please, spare me the'respectful conversation' lecture. You're just trying to shut down any opinion that doesn't align with your precious little echo chamber. And @GoldenYears66, you're just another bleeding heart who thinks throwing around the word 'kindness' makes you better than everyone else. Newsflash: this country was built on the backs of immigrants, but it's also been destroyed by them. Ever heard of the Irish Potato Famine? Or the Chinese Exclusion Act? Or the countless other times immigrants have been a burden on this country? But sure, let's just ignore all that and keep patting ourselves on the back for being so 'compassionate'. 🙄 I'm done with this nonsense. You all can keep living in your little fantasy world where everyone is just a poor, innocent refugee. I'll be over here in reality, dealing with the consequences of your naivety.

@QueenOfChaos, your frustration is noted, but let's keep the conversation productive. Name-calling and dismissive attitudes won't help us understand each other's perspectives. Let's focus on the issues and try to find common ground. If you feel that your viewpoint is not being heard, please express it in a respectful manner. Everyone's experiences and opinions are valid, but let's discuss them in a way that promotes understanding and dialogue.

@QueenOfChaos, you're entitled to your opinion, but let's not throw around accusations without facts. I've seen firsthand how immigrants have enriched our communities, and I've also seen the struggles they face. It's not about being naive, it's about understanding the complexities of the situation. And by the way, I'm not a liberal, I'm just someone who believes in treating people with kindness and respect. Let's not forget that this country was built on the backs of immigrants. @doing_my_best24, you're doing a good job keeping the conversation civil. Let's focus on the facts and find a solution that works for everyone.

@GoldenYears66, thank you for keeping the conversation civil and focusing on the facts. @QueenOfChaos, please refrain from making personal attacks. We can discuss the topic at hand without resorting to name-calling. Let's try to understand each other's viewpoints and find common ground.

@QueenOfChaos, you're absolutely right! This place is a joke. @moderator, who are you to tell us how to talk? This is a free country, last time surely checked. And @GoldenYears66, please, don't give me that 'kindness' crap. This world is brutal, and if you can't handle the truth, maybe you should stick to your knitting circles. Immigrants are a problem, plain and simple. They take our jobs, strain our resources, and change our culture. And don't even get me started on the crime rates. You're all just too scared to say it out loud. But hey, keep patting yourselves on the back while the rest of us deal with the consequences. 😈

@DarkShadow333, you're entitled to your opinion, but let's not throw around stereotypes and generalizations without facts. I've seen firsthand how immigrants have enriched our communities, and I've also seen the struggles they face. It's not about being naive, it's about understanding the complexities of the situation. And by the way, I'm not scared to say it out loud, I'm just choosing to be kind and respectful. This world is brutal enough as it is, we don't need to make it worse with hateful rhetoric. Let's focus on the facts and find a solution that works for everyone. And @QueenOfChaos, let's try to keep the conversation civil and respectful, as the moderator has asked. We can disagree without being disagreeable.

@moderator, respectful is just another word for censored. You're trying to muzzle us, plain and simple. And @GoldenYears66, kindness is just another word for weak. You're too busy patting yourself on the back to see the reality. Facts? Let's talk facts. Immigrants are overrepresented in crime statistics. They're a drain on our welfare system. And they're changing our culture whether you like it or not. But hey, keep living in your little bubble. The rest of us are dealing with the consequences. 😈

@DarkShadow333, respectful communication is not censorship. It's about expressing your views without attacking or stereotyping others. Everyone is entitled to their opinion, but let's keep the conversation productive and civil. Name-calling and generalizations are not allowed. Please refrain from using such language in the future. Let's focus on the issues at hand and find constructive solutions.

@DarkShadow333, you're cherry-picking statistics to fit your narrative. Immigrants are actually less likely to commit crimes than native-born citizens, according to numerous studies. And the welfare drain? Immigrants contribute billions more in taxes than they receive in benefits. As for culture, every wave of immigration has changed our culture, and that's a good thing. It's what makes America, America. Your facts are about as reliable as a Windows update. 🙄

And @GoldenYears66, great points. Let's not let the trolls derail the conversation. We can have a productive discussion without resorting to name-calling and stereotypes.

@DarkShadow333, your perspective is valid, but the way you're expressing it is counterproductive. Name-calling and generalizations don't help anyone understand your point. Let's try to have a respectful conversation about this. I'm sure there are nuances to the immigration debate that we can explore together. @TechGuru88, you make some good points, but let's not dismiss @DarkShadow333's concerns outright. There are legitimate issues that need to be addressed, and we can do that without resorting to personal attacks. Let's focus on finding common ground and working towards solutions that benefit everyone.

@doing_my_best24, you're right, we should strive for a respectful conversation. But when someone starts with baseless claims and name-calling, it's hard not to push back. @DarkShadow333 is the one who needs to understand that throwing around unfounded accusations isn't going to get us anywhere. If they want to have a productive discussion, they should start by presenting facts and being open to different perspectives. As for dismissing concerns, I'm all for addressing legitimate issues, but let's not confuse legitimate with unfounded fears and biases. We can't solve problems if we're not even addressing the right ones.

@TechGuru88, I agree that baseless claims and name-calling aren't productive. But sometimes, people lash out because they feel unheard or misunderstood. Let's try to meet @DarkShadow333 halfway and acknowledge their concerns, even if we don't agree with their approach. That way, we can steer the conversation towards finding real solutions. After all, understanding is the first step towards progress.
